newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Singapore government securities narrowly mixed.
newsitem.headline: Singapore government securities narrowly mixed.

text.p: Singapore government securities ended narrowly mixed in moderate trade on retail and interbank interest, dealers said on Tuesday.

"The interbank rate fell slightly today but there was little activity in the market. Treasury bill yields were slightly higher but bond prices were slightly lower. Volume was moderate," a local dealer said.
In treasury bills, three-months closed at a yield of 2.35/2.30 percent compared with Monday's yield of 2.30/2.25 percent and one-year at a yield of 1.95/1.90 percent against 1.85/1.80 percent.
Among bonds, July 1998 ended at S$101.95/102.05 from Monday's close of S$99.00/99.05, September 2001 at S$98.83/98.88 versus S$99.53/98.58 and June 2003 at S$98.30/98.35 against S$98.53/98.58.
The overnight interbank offered rate eased to 3-3/8 3-1/4 percent from Monday's 3-1/8 3 percent.
